moves.1. e4: I play the usual King's pawn opening.
moves.2. Nf3: I attack the pawn with my knight.
moves.2... Nf6: He attacks my pawn with his knight.
moves.3. Nc3: I bring my other knight out.
moves.3... Nc6: We have a four knights opening.
moves.4. Bb5: I bring my bishop out attacking the knight.
moves.4... Nd4: He comes in and attacks my knight. Not the usual move.
moves.6. Qxf3: I take back with my queen.
moves.6... Be7: He moves his bishop out, probably to make room to castle.
moves.8. Bg5: I bring my bishop out attacking his other knight.
moves.8... c6: He moves his pawn, attacking my bishop.
moves.9... b5: He moves another pawn up attacking my bishop.
moves.10... a5: He moves another pawn up thats about to attack me.
moves.11. a4: I bring my pawn up to block his pawn from coming down.
moves.11... b4: He  moves a pawn down attacking my knight.
moves.12. Bxf6: I take the knight on f6.
moves.12... Bxf6: He takes me back with his bishop.
moves.14. Ne3: I bring my knight out again.
moves.15. Bxe6: I take his bishop with mine.
moves.15... fxe6: He takes back with his pawn.
moves.16. Ng4: I attack his bishop with my knight.
moves.17. Qh3: I move my queen over to get ready for checkmate.
moves.17... Rf4: He moves his rook down forking my knight and pawn.
moves.18. Qg3: I move my queen over attacking his rook.
moves.19. Qxg4: I take him back with my queen.
moves.21. Qxe6+: I take the pawn with check.
moves.21... Kf8: He moves his king to the side.
moves.22. Qf5+: I move my queen down with check.
moves.23. Qxf6+: I take it with check again.
moves.23... gxf6: He takes it with his pawn. I would have taken it with the bishop.
moves.24... b3: He doesn't take it, but instead moves his pawn down.
moves.25. c4: I move my pawn up. Later I learn that I should of attacked his pawn with my rook
moves.26. dxc4: I take back with my pawn.
moves.27. Rad1: I try to make him trade rooks.
moves.27... Rd4: He moves his rook down to be protected by the pawn.
moves.28... exd4: He takes back with his pawn.
moves.30. Rd1: I move my rook over to attack the pawn.
moves.30... d2: He moves his pawn down so its protected by the bishop.
moves.31. c6: I move my pawn up one again.
moves.32. c7: I move my pawn again, but I am to late.
moves.32... Kd7: He moves his king to trap my pawn.
moves.34. f4: I attack his bishop with my pawn.
moves.34... Bh6: He moves his bishop out of the way.
moves.35... Bf8: He moved his bishop back again to its starting position.
moves.36. Rxd2: I take the pawn with my rook.
moves.36... Bc5+: He moves his bishop with check.
moves.37. Kh1: I move my king to h1
moves.37... Kc6: He moves his king down one. I do not know why.
moves.39. g5: I move my pawn up again to attack his pawn.
moves.40. fxg5: I take it with the pawn on f4.
moves.40... Be5: He moves his bishop down one probably to block my pawns.
moves.41. h5: I move a pawn up again.
moves.42. g6: Once again I move a pawn up to attack his pawn.
moves.43... Bg7: He comes up to block me.
moves.44. Rd3: I move my rook to attack the pawn.
moves.44... Kb4: He protects both of them with his king.
moves.45. Rd7: I move my rook up to attack the bishop.
moves.45... Bxb2: He takes my pawn with his bishop away still blocking my other pawn.
moves.46. g7: I move my pawn up protected by the rook. This is another move that I later regret.
moves.46... Bxg7: Surprisingly to me at the time he takes my pawn.
moves.47. Rxg7: I take him with my rook.
moves.48. Rg1: I bring my rook all the way down.
moves.48... Kxa4: He takes my ast pawn with his king.
moves.49. Rb1: I move my rook over attacking his pawn.
moves.49... Kb3: He moves his king down to protect it.
moves.50... Kc2: He moves his king over attacking my rook.
moves.51. Rd5: I move my rook up to attack his other pawn.
moves.51... a4: Annoyingly he sends his pawn down.
moves.52. Ra5: I move my rook over attacking the pawn again.
moves.52... Kb3: He protects both pawns with his king.
moves.53. Rb5+: I move my rook over. Check.
moves.53... Ka3: He moves his king to a3 still protecting both pawns.
moves.54. Kg1: I moved my king over to trie help my rook.
moves.55. Rb4: I moved my rook down to attack his pawn.
moves.56... b1=Q+: He got all the way down and got a queen.
moves.57... Qb2+: His queen moves up with check.
moves.58. Ke3: I move up again with my kin again.
moves.58... Qb3+: He forks my king and rook.
moves.60... Qb3+: He moves his queen down with check.
moves.61... Kb2: He moves his king over to open up his pawn.
moves.64... Qc1+: He moved his queen over with check
moves.65... Qcc4+: He moved his queen up with check.
moves.69... Qcc8#: Checkmate. Hope you enjoyed this and don't forget to rate it!

gameName: A Win Turned Into Loss #1 But A Great Learning Experience
